titleStmt.title: Henry H. Farmer to James F. Robinson
CWG7971

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p: I was elected one of the justices of Henderson county in 1860 ^also in 1861^. Not wishing to hold the office I declined being a candidate at the last election. The person elected in my place declines accepting the office, -- now as I do not wish to hold the office, I now tender to you my resignation, to take effect immediately after the next August election, at which time you can order an election to be held for choosing my successor,

Henry H. Farmer resigns as Justice of Henderson to take effect after Augt. Election
May 30. 1863

Hon. James F. Robinson
Frankfort
Ky
